elements.2211.03254_07f2488c817e274345ae64bf18ceb: Retarding field energy analyzers and Langmuir probes are routinely used to obtain ion and electron energy distribution functions (IEDF, EEDF)
elements.2211.03254_e6abb2fc28f7cd6f6a36746d6117a: These typically require knowledge of the first and second derivatives of the
elements.2211.03254_9456b8541c7fc2d612f4c3bed0908: characteristics, both of which can be obtained in various ways
elements.2211.03254_206751c821bcbe70b83e1ea4d63cc: This poses challenges inherent to differentiating noisy signals, a frequent problem with electric-probe plasma diagnostics
elements.2211.03254_ac1a108bee5de461c26ffcb0d4716: A brief review of commonly used analog and numerical filtering and differentiation techniques is presented, together with their application on experimental data collected in a radio-frequency plasma
elements.2211.03254_dea15cdc40a71b35a18baaab54925: The application of each method is detailed with regards to the obtained IEDF and EEDF, the deduced plasma parameters, dynamic range, energy resolution and signal distortion.
elements.2211.03254_38a32b304586bf87fba62a0a93d48: Distribution functions offer a detailed description of plasma charged particles: from obtaining some useful plasma parameters (e.g. density, temperature and potential) to deducing heating and transport mechanisms, collision and reaction rates, as well as detecting the presence of particles sub-populations
elements.2211.03254_8d96b163084ee290d6fa14c3040bd: The ion-energy distribution function (IEDF) is extensively employed to characterize the ion kinetics in plasma processing techniques and in the development of spacecraft electric propulsion technologies, where the detection of accelerated ion populations, such as ion beams, is important
elements.2211.03254_f58c497f66e6ed56831aef23f612e: The electron-energy distribution function (EEDF) gives an extensive picture of the dynamics of electrons
elements.2211.03254_b869e304d87b477027c565e1365f4: This is essential for characterizing the plasma generation mechanisms in laboratory and commercial plasma devices, as well as in investigating fundamental aspects of plasma physics, e.g. the thermodynamics of magnetized electrons
elements.2211.03254_4327a300dea1d112e116dc95a45c1: Electrostatic probes, such as retarding field energy analyzers (RFEA) and single Langmuir probes (LP), are some of the most common instruments for measuring ion and electron distribution functions, respectively
elements.2211.03254_2ace8bb9b940708c50d6e7fc1a33c: The plasma potential, and the ion beam potential and density are usually obtained through the first derivative of an RFEA
elements.2211.03254_3077c68ec1ee005e0d8baeb7740d1: characteristic, the floating potential, electron temperature, plasma density, and plasma potential can be inferred via the classical Langmuir method
elements.2211.03254_b1502ed83d3de428353f66994b979: While popular thanks to its apparent simplicity, this method is only valid for plasmas with Maxwellian electron distributions and can be inaccurate in determining the plasma potential and ion current
elements.2211.03254_51e237ba6030b27a11648b26bcd36: Alternatively, the Druyvesteyn method directly determines the electron distribution function from the second derivative of the LP
elements.2211.03254_c72986fce8e6d7e4e902d3792d709: characteristics, a process inherently more robust and information-rich than the Langmuir method, yet more challenging owing to the double differentiation

elements.2211.03254_4bdeb51e46b61db72c64ba04e2c8b: IEDF and EEDF are usually obtained through a variety of analog and numerical differentiation routines

elements.2211.03254_e0f0cb2b03cc955fff44a79bf4881: The aim of this paper is to review different signal processing and differentiation methods for the acquisition of optimal ion- and electron-energy distribution functions
elements.2211.03254_07299463a729b0b5df4cfe60f6696: The study discusses analog and numerical processing techniques that are routinely used to obtain EEDFs and IEDFs
elements.2211.03254_ce3705fbedd0f45feba5feaa5e020: With respect to the latter, the focus is on processing IEDFs that show the presence of multiple ion populations
elements.2211.03254_8b7473e5efb8b78e05388eed8794b: The different numerical processes reviewed to obtain the first and second derivatives from the I-V characteristics are: Savitzky-Golay (SG) filter, B-spline piecewise polynomial fitting (BS), Gaussian filter (GF), and the Blackman window filter (BW)
elements.2211.03254_acdfde4cb50b3c4559b412ad02662: The ion-energy distribution function is also computed using the Gaussian deconvolution method

elements.2211.03254_23beccc1ffec73133b11d2a540da6: pairs and applying the filter only requires convolution of the coefficients with the raw data
elements.2211.03254_f0d65a2720040e1e65939d397bd07: A benefit of this property is that the smoothed signal can be differentiated
elements.2211.03254_bcac55f22daa339c955ef5273c9e0: derivative of the fitting polynomial, i.e. with the appropriate convolution coefficients
elements.2211.03254_19178b1fe17d0351514d0b4d23559: This avoids having to recourse to numerical finite difference methods which tend to decrease the S/N. This can be understood by considering that the differential operator in the frequency domain is proportional to the frequency itself

elements.2211.03254_ad64804eb4a6fc140c211c5636bf5: give the same coefficients for odd derivatives
elements.2211.03254_0f9a753cb8e15a2e164c5c6d8e613: The SG filter acts as a low-pass filter with a flat passband whose cut-off frequency is a function of
elements.2211.03254_d72b793f32531147f10793ba30c3c: The cut-off frequency typically increases with
elements.2211.03254_e118dd329fc147c3f000af479807b: , the benefit of lower cut-off frequencies is compromised by distortions of the higher frequency content of the data

elements.2211.03254_b207d2859fffc55f00afd22f3b3c6: can preserve the narrow features of a signal (such as peaks) but at the cost of increasing the cut-off frequency

elements.2211.03254_765bffe90789cd5b02c00a301b96a: The piecewise polynomial approach used for data smoothing is the cardinal or uniform B-spline method

elements.2211.03254_9d99e9729a9c563d8934a6ca8e712: Like other polynomial regressions, the fitting polynomial
elements.2211.03254_fe28cd9947875d7519982bb5839e1: can be expressed as a linear combination of coefficients
elements.2211.03254_ab175a736004bfdf62060b370fdfa: Spline functions can therefore be calculated on different bases and the B-spline is a particular case for basis functions with local support, i.e. taking non-zero values only inside the interval on which they are defined, which spans
elements.2211.03254_96b905457a613d5b6a28df9880267: As a result, this method results in a higher numerical stability compared to other splines
elements.2211.03254_25450331bd61b4327510528fb7c5e: is fitted to the data by using the least-square principle to calculate the
elements.2211.03254_01eb3bacc95ef206a5c08d7e56878: Additionally, the continuity conditions need to be verified, such that the function is
elements.2211.03254_b53b3566a961324449d99ec4325a2: times differentiable at the knots and that
elements.2211.03254_0a48374c24eee05641ea67f4bb19b: The larger the number of knots, the higher the accuracy of the data fitting

elements.2211.03254_8bb8594cbfe53fba4f9ce7018e4a9: The Gaussian filter was developed by
elements.2211.03254_b4035b221544d8b8cbff9edc94161: who introduced a new smoothing routine involving the use of a Gaussian distribution function as a filter.
elements.2211.03254_be2e47692dd66d008cfdbbbe93fef: used this algorithm to smooth the
elements.2211.03254_db78fa41cbd964c55f2993266f8ff: characteristics measured with a Langmuir probe and obtain the electron-energy probability function
elements.2211.03254_ba96753069d4e35a4a6a433599e95: The working principle of the Gaussian filter is based on the assumption that the response function of the instrument and its electronics can be approximated as a Gaussian distribution with a given standard deviation
elements.2211.03254_131eed890915194f465f630fd0e1e: The measured signal can then be calculated from the convolution of the experimental data
elements.2211.03254_754db43cb2111632061f3f56c5071: Because the noise is not correlated with the instrument response function,
elements.2211.03254_6e9bbfb606e9acf82cc1d71120fdc: can be used for noise suppression
elements.2211.03254_9497a12d1a7ba3c2171074856e58d: , the raw data can be convolved with the first and second derivative of the Gaussian function in order to obtain the first and second derivative of the
elements.2211.03254_9106a15ba8f3affab8ae6babc3eda: characteristic instead of using the central difference method
elements.2211.03254_a9b3d850cec943ac10e9dc95006fd: Nevertheless, for the sake of comparison with earlier results
elements.2211.03254_0a17823722fce9dfe42a6139408d2: , the central difference method was used to evaluate the derivatives.
elements.2211.03254_8267b4b8f641585b371349dad9abe: is a standard moving average window, having zero value outside a chosen interval
elements.2211.03254_18b39d9d8087bac11bc92f8fd21da: It has been previously used to filter
elements.2211.03254_bf2978106d72f2bfdc6b37c3c8b6c: The Blackman window is defined by only one filtering parameter, i.e. the window size
elements.2211.03254_311fbd1195e026bac788bb00ef5a0: It is characterised by the highest reduction in the sidelobe level (down to
elements.2211.03254_50c015475cb53ec13009335ead5c5: dB) when compared to the other window functions (e.g
elements.2211.03254_b5532469909dfbb40eac9b2dcdc15: However, it has a wider mainlobe resulting in a less sharp transition band in the passband of the filter that can be improved by choosing a wider window size
elements.2211.03254_858c15e3d233e15c57c34bed0783d: The derivatives cannot be obtained analytically for the Blackman window, thus a central difference operator was used after filtering the raw
elements.2211.03254_710d048292f63af3b8a6ae1767673: The Gaussian deconvolution method, or Gaussian fitting, has been used to obtain the ion-energy distribution function from the
elements.2211.03254_87535c98f68faee79b9144c2684f4: characteristics measured by a retarding field energy analyzer
elements.2211.03254_79167cdb7990fd71e655850656808: This involves an iterative process of integrating a Gaussian curve that models the ion-energy distribution function until the raw
elements.2211.03254_2b2b4322c23453925347d837fbea8: The fitting can either be manual, or an automatic Gaussian fitting algorithm can be implemented that minimises the sum of the squared errors between the measured and the reconstructed data
elements.2211.03254_a62ff3d75f6a338334b1eacf69222: For a single ion population, the ion-energy distribution function can be modeled with a Gaussian curve
elements.2211.03254_906c623ac98bc10400fd3aeb3c26a: where the parameters to be fit are: the amplitude
elements.2211.03254_7ac3bf127ca251eacc50270ae466d: , and the location of the Gaussian peak
elements.2211.03254_954284425e98ce5d0f949552f59ac: When a second ion population is present, as in the case of an accelerated ion beam in a collisional plasma, the IEDF requires the fitting of two or three Gaussian curves which are summed to accurately model the measured
elements.2211.03254_e70675452d8b897ac9b9a92535875: An advantage of this technique is that it does not involve any filtering or differentiation steps since the IEDF is obtained in a retrograde approach.
elements.2211.03254_7eebc6da32c59893ef206d995901c: Example of Application on a Data Set
elements.2211.03254_07d37ca03912aa61403d4188996f8: The optimal evaluation of the ion and/or energy distribution functions through numerical methods requires a compromise in the choice of parameters to achieve sufficient noise-reduction without causing significant distortion of the fitted
elements.2211.03254_3d37e9e0e36d88ff1fc1781f86f56: characteristics that could lead to large errors in the inferred plasma parameters and loss of information
elements.2211.03254_d88f8a0d3c4783c16028e0a13966e: An analysis similar to that used by
elements.2211.03254_a11a968601f3ee8f497b281b87056: is used to assess the numerical methods in this work
elements.2211.03254_ea10072f1596a960dbafc3b58d8e3: It is noted that in Ref.
elements.2211.03254_79bc9e6e4de25392734bc56d04799: , the comparison of the different techniques was conducted on simulated
elements.2211.03254_9a384c5a566e4bc889666f4b2f6c6: characteristics, while in this study only experimental data are used
elements.2211.03254_f0cc09ec3311a7c15d604fa8e58a2: The following parameters, evaluated between the raw probe collected current
elements.2211.03254_55db0ab7314319305ff539f87415b: , were considered: the mean squared error (MSE) and the Shapiro-Wilk (SW) test statistic
elements.2211.03254_9505dbccd206d0b0f7d0ba70e725c: When comparing different regression models, an optimal processing technique would return the lowest mean squared error
elements.2211.03254_7dbfabca9f412af28d1ae0dd35cc7: However, because the MSE value can range between zero and any larger number depending on the scale of the variables, it does not provide a standardized metric to assess how well the processing actually models the observed data
elements.2211.03254_ca9514fcf1cdb1b0ff7561334d963: Moreover, the MSE on its own does not provide a way to highlight under-smoothing and over-fitting as these situations could return the lowest possible MSE
elements.2211.03254_7ed2f14fe8131bf86d00cd828a754: Thus, an analysis of the distribution of the residuals (
elements.2211.03254_f7976a56c2fd981f51d0b387c6cc6: ) is necessary to complement the MSE
elements.2211.03254_57003d63dfa1a9f55eab78dc44840: In particular, verifying that the residuals are normally distributed ensures that the data processing does not significantly distort the
elements.2211.03254_8d94dac724586338392b732927349: The Shapiro-Wilk test checks the null-hypothesis that the residuals are normally distributed by comparing the computed statistic
elements.2211.03254_adde58181694080943791cb44d17f: For a given significance level, if
elements.2211.03254_bb9ba5253fb19b8b1b523d44b15e4: is smaller than the tabulated value then the null-hypothesis can be rejected, i.e. the residuals are not normally distributed
elements.2211.03254_f605069f3e536a761d0f5fb945b2d: Since filtering and fitting always somewhat distorts the data, one should aim to maximize
elements.2211.03254_8dd5595bc986e83c1bbdf5ff0c1ee: and re-evaluate the data processing when the null-hypothesis is rejected
elements.2211.03254_d6a21ebb35bc30f98e6d16d261a79: Taking a 0.01 significance level and given the samples size used in this study, the null-hypothesis is rejected if
elements.2211.03254_313405cf77b241cad214b81aecf08: Therefore, a parametric analysis is conducted together with a visual optimization of the IEDF and EEPF for determining the optimal parameters for each numerical method
elements.2211.03254_09cb4e532e5cfc9accd3e7ef0e7f9: The assessment requires a trade-off between minimizing the MSE, maximizing
elements.2211.03254_8b093f48a08470d5691b32027eaf5: and minimizing alterations of the raw

elements.2211.03254_4bf71369c00d36ae8518561ba1653: Similarly, optimal evaluation of the EEDFs requires simultaneously maximizing the energy resolution and the dynamic range (DR)

elements.2211.03254_c57ed190d29160036165a8efb30d1: Because the bulk of the electrons are in the low-energy region of the EEPF, the larger
elements.2211.03254_2473d249b56071f39aeec30d3dfad: , the larger the errors in determining
elements.2211.03254_9a46ee1651cdae8ff329421c65703: An EEDF is considered to have sufficient energy resolution if
elements.2211.03254_0167b50fbd13a89c3bb35470dd2b2: The dynamic range of the EEPF is defined as the ratio of its maximum to its minimum resolvable value
elements.2211.03254_4c3771cb8c6d58b06b795acff3b1b: dB (equivalently of 3 orders of magnitude and above) is necessary to resolve high-energy electrons in the inelastic range of the EEPF, which are detrimental in investigating excitation, ionization, and transport processes

elements.2211.03254_8ef1becce432705a49a51886e76fc: This review outlines some of the most frequently employed data processing methods to obtain ion and electron-energy distribution functions from
elements.2211.03254_dc89888a04ddd6bf27096bb1690e8: characteristics measured with a retarding field energy analyzer and an RF compensated Langmuir probe, respectively
elements.2211.03254_a64eeeda0ca8f9e7a94f98eb2bd1d: Design recommendations relevant to measurements in RF magnetized plasmas are presented for both instruments
elements.2211.03254_a4dc9a3caa34ee0d11b3bb0d301c7: After describing the different processing techniques, an example of a parametric analysis to obtain optimal IEDFs and EEPFs is presented and applied to experimental data sets collected in a magnetized RF plasma apparatus
elements.2211.03254_929fca4c4b2d04f7948af42c3d1f0: The recommended parameters optimization involves checking the mean-squared error and the normal distribution of the residuals (i.e. the Shapiro-Wilk test), coupled with a visual assessment process to ensure sufficient noise reduction with minimal distortion of the curves
elements.2211.03254_bf5d512e5fcf266245595ab0e1c0b: With respect to the IEDF, the analysis focused on the evaluation of first derivatives that accurately represented a plasma containing a bi-population of ions
elements.2211.03254_ab862607562bf50eee181b1e81ff9: For the data set under study, both the analog and numerical methods provide smooth IEDFs and consistent values of the local plasma and the ion beam potentials
elements.2211.03254_0f500a3f6d9e67dba08034c73c011: Regarding the numerical methods analyzed, they all perform well in terms of MSE and
elements.2211.03254_1aeda0f6cc5df48d520e9408f4a3a: ; in particular, the Saviztky-Golay filter and the Gaussian deconvolution methods delivered the best results in terms of obtaining accurate IEDFs with the least data distortion
elements.2211.03254_7d196bab42fb7859e6d0e573efdf0: The EEPFs obtained from each method are assessed in terms of maximizing the energy resolution and dynamic range while minimizing distortions of the Langmuir probe
elements.2211.03254_1cadc9b10b59f3243332e043ca896: Among the numerical methods, the Savitzky-Golay filter and the B-spline fitting performed best in terms of distortion and energy resolution
elements.2211.03254_323541fa24ec6d389162d2efa2199: All numerical methods delivered a mediocre dynamic range of approximately 2 orders of magnitude, which is to be related to the experimental data set employed having a low signal-to-noise ratio of
elements.2211.03254_42c12e780320c318bde7c497b84e1: This could make it challenging to confidently identify the nature of the electron distribution function and to study inelastic electron processes
elements.2211.03254_79e3ee46c8446c21f0c83bd8aa70f: This is in contrast with the EEPF obtained from the same
elements.2211.03254_83edafefec2b30d7da267d4b8a4c6: curve using the analog differentiator which showed a dynamic range of approximately 3 orders of magnitude and can be clearly identified as being Maxwellian up to
elements.2211.03254_d27d690b53029e76550a79572a19a: When the intent of calculating the EEPF is solely to obtain the plasma parameters, all methods explored are found to deliver equivalent results
elements.2211.03254_c690408a73b188b3631f7b8107483: The analog differentiator technique provides an appreciable reduction in the IEDF and EEPF processing time compared to the numerical methods since no data-set specific optimization is required.
elements.2211.03254_885a3f45b1e2344294273acd835f1: The data that support the findings of this study are available from the corresponding author upon reasonable request.
